sentences.english: A charlatan murders without a knife.
She might be taken in by those quack doctors.
sentences.chinese: 她很可能會被那些庸醫給騙了。

sentences.english: The quack was stormed with questions.
I ccouldn't believe a barber - surgeon like him would cure my tracheitis.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信這樣一個庸醫可以治好我的氣管炎。

sentences.english: So-called "evidence-based medicine" has become modern-day quackery.
sentences.chinese: 所謂的循證醫學已經成爲當今的庸醫騙術。

sentences.english: That quack doctor for the clap used to be stuck up in all the greenhouses.
sentences.chinese: 每一應公用廁所都有治淋病的庸醫的招貼。

sentences.english: Quack, I eat how light hypnotic drugs is not the top at all?
sentences.chinese: 庸醫，我喫的藥怎麼光催眠不頂事呢？

sentences.english: B:I never trust those stupid doctors.
George Bush : You mean that OLD KOOK , that CHARLATAN?
sentences.chinese: 你是說那個老怪物，那位庸醫嗎？

sentences.english: I never trust those stupid doctors.

definition: to recount history but omit one's ancestors (idiom); to forget one's roots
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
